TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1235
TEI.2.document_title: George Y Bright to Stephen F. Austin, 11-26-1825

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1235

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Commerce New Orleans to Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="11-26-1825">Nov 26 1825*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Mr Lench*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Will confer a favour on me by informing *person_mentioned*Col. Austin*/person_mentioned* that I contemplate entering the *location_mentioned*Port of Rio Brasos de Dios*/location_mentioned* in the Month of *date_mentioned n="02-xx-1826">Feby, next*/date_mentioned*, that my object is to establish a *location_mentioned*commercial depot*/location_mentioned* for my own Goods, at some point convenient to where the Beaver are plenty, and pursue equally the accumulation of that article and the vending of my Goods, that I am concerned with a substantial*location_mentioned* House in N Orleans*/location_mentioned*, and will do all my business through his *location_mentioned*settlement*/location_mentioned*, that I have my *person_mentioned*associates */person_mentioned*now on the *location_mentioned*Rio Grande*/location_mentioned* making preperations, He will recollect me as the *person_mentioned*Son in Law of Mr. Charles Fremon de Lausiere*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*George Y Bright*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
